definitions.definition: Full extent; distance between extreme limits; especially; the distance between the nearest surfaces of two bodies, or the space between walls.
definitions.example: a room ten feet square in the clear

definitions.definition: The completion of a stage or challenge, or of the whole game.
A person who is free from the influence of engrams.
To remove obstructions, impediments or other unwanted items from.
definitions.example: If you clear the table, I'll wash up.

definitions.definition: To remove (items or material) so as to leave something unobstructed or open.
definitions.example: Please clear all this stuff off the table.

definitions.definition: To become free from obstruction or obscurement; to become transparent.
definitions.example: After a heavy rain, the sky cleared nicely for the evening.

definitions.definition: To eliminate ambiguity or doubt from (a matter); to clarify or resolve; to clear up.
definitions.example: We need to clear this issue once and for all.

definitions.definition: To remove from suspicion, especially of having committed a crime.
definitions.example: The court cleared the man of murder.

definitions.definition: To pass without interference; to miss.
definitions.example: The door just barely clears the table as it closes.

definitions.definition: (activities such as jumping or throwing) To exceed a stated mark.
definitions.example: She was the first female high jumper to clear two metres.

definitions.definition: To finish or complete (a stage, challenge, or game).
definitions.example: I cleared the first level in 36 seconds.

definitions.definition: Of a check or financial transaction, to go through as payment; to be processed so that the money is transferred.
definitions.example: The check might not clear for a couple of days.

definitions.definition: To earn a profit of; to net.
definitions.example: He's been clearing seven thousand a week.

definitions.definition: To approve or authorise for a particular purpose or action; to give clearance to.
definitions.example: Air traffic control cleared the plane to land.

definitions.definition: To obtain approval or authorisation in respect of.
definitions.example: I've cleared the press release with the marketing department, so go ahead and publish it.

definitions.definition: To obtain a clearance.
definitions.example: The steamer cleared for Liverpool today.

definitions.definition: To obtain permission to use (a sample of copyrighted audio) in another track.
To disengage oneself from incumbrances, distress, or entanglements; to become free.
To hit, kick, head, punch etc. (a ball, puck) away in order to defend one's goal.
definitions.example: A low cross came in, and Smith cleared.

definitions.definition: To reset or unset; to return to an empty state or to zero.
definitions.example: to clear an array;  to clear a single bit (binary digit) in a value

definitions.definition: To style (an element within a document) so that it is not permitted to float at a given position.
Transparent in colour.
definitions.example: as clear as crystal

definitions.definition: Bright, not dark or obscured.
definitions.example: Congress passed the President’s Clear Skies legislation.

definitions.definition: Free of obstacles.
definitions.example: The coast is clear.

definitions.definition: Without clouds.
definitions.example: clear weather; a clear day

definitions.definition: Of the sky, such that less than one eighth of its area is obscured by clouds.
Free of ambiguity or doubt.
definitions.example: Do I make myself clear? Crystal clear.

definitions.definition: Distinct, sharp, well-marked.
Free of guilt, or suspicion.
definitions.example: a clear conscience

definitions.definition: (of a soup) Without a thickening ingredient.
Possessing little or no perceptible stimulus.
definitions.example: clear of texture;  clear of odor

definitions.definition: Free from the influence of engrams; see Clear (Scientology).
Able to perceive clearly; keen; acute; penetrating; discriminating.
definitions.example: a clear intellect; a clear head

definitions.definition: Not clouded with passion; serene; cheerful.
Easily or distinctly heard; audible.
Unmixed; entirely pure.
definitions.example: clear sand

definitions.definition: Without defects or blemishes, such as freckles or knots.
definitions.example: a clear complexion; clear lumber

definitions.definition: Without diminution; in full; net.
definitions.example: a clear profit

definitions.definition: All the way; entirely.
definitions.example: I threw it clear across the river to the other side.

definitions.definition: Not near something or touching it.
definitions.example: Stand clear of the rails, a train is coming.

definitions.definition: Free (or separate) from others
In a clear manner; plainly.
